revised_title: Observations on the Planet Venus and its Atmosphere
tldr: In this article, William Herschel discusses his observations and experiments on the planet Venus, focusing on its atmosphere, rotation, and potential for spotting mountains. Despite using advanced telescopes and techniques, Herschel could not confirm the existence of mountains on Venus or determine its rotation period accurately. He also mentions the possibility of optical deceptions and limitations in observing the planet due to its distance and atmospheric conditions.
